taxonConcepts.scientificName: Archocentrus centrarchus (Gill in Gill and Bransford, 1877)
Archocentrus centrarchus (Gill in Gill and Bransford, 1877)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.rights: No known copyright restrictions apply. See Agosti, D., Egloff, W., 2009. Taxonomic information exchange and copyright: the Plazi approach. BMC Research Notes 2009, 2:53 for further explanation.
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Juan J. Schmitter-Soto (2007): A systematic revision of the genus Archocentrus (Perciformes: Cichlidae), with the description of two new genera and six new species. Zootaxa 1603, 1-78: 73-73, URL:http://www.zoobank.org/urn:lsid:zoobank.org:pub:AFFCB590-1FC7-4CD0-950C-D1D1A6E59F6C
dataObjects.description:
Ar. centrarchus :

BMNH 1905.3.27.2 ( labelled “cotype” ), Nicaragua , Lake Nicaragua ; FMNH 5982 (62, XR), Nicaragua , Granada , Laguna Jenicero [ Jenizaro ] ; UMMZ 180612 (1, XR), Nicaragua ; UMMZ 180643 (1, XR), Costa Rica , Limón , Laguna Tortuguero, 2.5 mi from inlet ; UMMZ 224131 (50, 1 C&S, 1 partly skel., 16 dig.), Nicaragua , RioSapoa into Lake Nicaragua .
dataObjects.references: Juan J. Schmitter-Soto (2007): A systematic revision of the genus Archocentrus (Perciformes: Cichlidae), with the description of two new genera and six new species. Zootaxa 1603, 1-78: 73-73, URL:http://www.zoobank.org/urn:lsid:zoobank.org:pub:AFFCB590-1FC7-4CD0-950C-D1D1A6E59F6C

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits mainly shallow waters or swampy areas of lakes and rivers.  Often found in many eutrophic oxbow lakes, ponds, roadside ditches and remnant pools of floodplains with thick vegetation.  Prefers warm temperature and thrives in stagnant waters.  An open water substrate spawner which lays eggs in extreme shallows.  Fry feed on parents' dermal mucus for first few days (Ref. 7335).  Feeds on detritus and insects (Ref. 36880).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Central America:  Pacific slope, in tributaries of Fonseca Gulf in Honduras and Nicaragua; Atlantic slope in Río Chirripó (Río Matina) of Costa Rica to the Río San Juan and associated drainages of Nicaragua, including the Great Lakes.
dataObjects.references: Schmitter-Soto, J.J. 2007 A systematic revision of the genus Archocentrus (Perciformes: Cichlidae), with the description of two new genera and six new species. Zootaxa 1603:1-78. (Ref. 74403)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Pacific slope of Central America: Costa Rica, Honduras and Nicaragua.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 15 - 17; Dorsal soft rays (total): 7 - 9; Anal spines: 9 - 11; Analsoft rays: 7 - 9

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Conkel, D. 1993 Cichlids of North and Central America. T.F.H. Publications, Inc., USA. (Ref. 7335)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: This species is distinguished by the following characters:  16- 19 total gill rakers on first arch, with rakers elongate and slender; 2 spots on opercle, vertically aligned; posterior end of maxilla not concave; circumpeduncular scales modally 18 or fewer; rows of secondary pored scales present on caudal fin; bars on side of body extending partially onto dorsal and anal fins, no medial intensification in bars on side of body, ocellus present on dorsal fin of mature females; in life abdomen predominantly yellow-green; caudal blotch ocellated (Ref. 74403).
